title: Cara Delevingne unveiled as face of Dior’s fine jewellery collections
text:
Cara Delevingne is rocking it as the face of Dior’s new jewellery collections (Picture: Alexi Pissourios)

Cara Delevingne is a woman of many talents – acting, singing, and modelling – and now she’s the face of Dior’s fine jewellery collections.

You’re probably used to seeing Cara as a face of fashion brands since she’s worked with most of the big names, from Oscar de la Renta, Chanel and Fendi to Dolce & Gabbana, Stella McCartney and Marc Jacobs.

And now the Carnival Row star is showcasing her talents once again in stunning photos of her wearing the beautiful collections from Dior Joaillerie.

Many of the pictures are, unusually, in black and white, and see Cara displaying the bold jewellery while capturing her striking appearance and quirky personality.

The 27-year-old also shot a video for Dior’s campaign, this time in colour, which see her in a playful light, juggling with giant versions of the pendants.

She’s pulling a load of hilarious faces too.

Then at the end, she’s physically blown out of the shot.

Cara has so many talents and basically we want to be her (Picture: Dior)

Basically it all looked like great fun and we wish we’d been involved.

The Paper Towns actress certainly seemed to be having a great time throughout the whole affair.

Cara rocked the black and white shots for Dior’s new jewellery shoot (Picture: Alexi Pissourios)

Then again she puts a lot of how she feels now down to her girlfriend, Ashley Benson.

Cara was rumoured to get together with the Pretty Little Liars actress in May 2018 although it wasn’t until September that year that Ashley confirmed it officially.

And in our eyes, they’re absolute couple goals.

Cara really brought out her fun personality in the video ad for Dior (Picture: Dior)

Recently Cara said her relationship with Ashley made her a ‘better, happier person’.

It’s not that the relationship isn’t difficult when it’s so long-distance, Cara explained to Net-A-Porter’s PorterEdit, but she said: ‘We make it work. We have to.’
